pullRequest.body:
Currently, `Subrel r {x | p x}` interacts poorly with `simp`, as the type signature is rewritten from `â†‘{x | p x} â†’ â†‘{x | p x} â†’ Prop` to `{x // p x} â†’ {x // p x} â†’ Prop`. This can be avoided by writing `Subrel r p` instead.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [ ] depends on: #20413

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [c923398141](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20475/commits/c923398141cbb53bf1662daa09232dae4e3ad854)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsAsymm Î± r] (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : IsAsymm _ (Subrel r p)`
`+ instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsIrrefl Î± r] (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : IsIrrefl _ (Subrel r p)`
`+ instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsRefl Î± r] (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : IsRefl _ (Subrel r p)`
`+ instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsSymm Î± r] (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : IsSymm _ (Subrel r p)`
`+ instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsTrans Î± r] (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : IsTrans _ (Subrel r p)`
`+ instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsWellOrder Î± r] (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : IsWellOrder _ (Subrel r p)`
`- instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) (p : Î± â†’ Prop) [IsWellOrder Î± r] :`
`- instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsAsymm Î± r] (p : Set Î±) : IsAsymm p (Subrel r p)`
`- instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsIrrefl Î± r] (p : Set Î±) : IsIrrefl p (Subrel r p)`
`- instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsRefl Î± r] (p : Set Î±) : IsRefl p (Subrel r p)`
`- instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsSymm Î± r] (p : Set Î±) : IsSymm p (Subrel r p)`
`- instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsTrans Î± r] (p : Set Î±) : IsTrans p (Subrel r p)`
`- instance (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) [IsWellOrder Î± r] (p : Set Î±) : IsWellOrder p (Subrel r p)`
`-++- codRestrict`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20413~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

```suggestion
/-- `Subrel r p` is the inherited relation on a subtype.
```

I don't think we need this comment; subtypes are the more primitive object anyway, and generally we only built the Set specialization if se *also* have the subtype one.

I guess you could rephrase this as "we could also consider a `Set.Subrel r s` variant for dot notation, but this ends up interacting poorly with `simpNF`".
I like that phrasing, I'll be copying it over.

May as well drop the eta expansion:
```suggestion
def Subrel (r : Î± â†’ Î± â†’ Prop) (p : Î± â†’ Prop) : Subtype p â†’ Subtype p â†’ Prop :=
```
I don't agree with this change, as [`Set.codRestrict`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.html#Set.codRestrict) is written in terms of a `Set`.

Shouldn't this be
```suggestion
  let r' := Subrel r fun i => âˆ€ j, r j i â†’ f j < f i
```

pullRequest.title: refactor: redefine `Subrel` in terms of `Î± â†’ Prop` instead of `Set Î±`

source.title: feat: linear order is isomorphic to lexicographic sum of two intervals
